page.title: 01Dalton Village today
page.content: The village of {Dalton} is set where rolling farm land joins rough moor. It is sited on an old drovers' road along which cattle were driven from Scotland to the South. The village appears to have been divided into three areas, {East Dalton,Dalton Travers and Dalton. Important buildings in the village are the {Church of St James;}the {Methodist Chapel;}the{village hall;} a {general dealers shop and Post Office; the {Travellers Rest} public house and an {old water mill.}This latter building is currently undergoing renovation as a cottage for tourists. The church was erected in 1898 at a cost of Â£800 and replaced a small chapel-of-ease. Sunday Services are held only twice per month. The Methodist Chapel dates from 1855 and is still in use in spite of its external appearance.
